audit.title: SSNAP-style Stroke Pathway Audit (Demo)
audit.description: Demo questionnaire inspired by themes/metrics referenced in ‘SSNAP State of the Nation Report 2025’ (e.g., onset→arrival time, imaging timeliness, hyperacute assessment, thrombolysis/thrombectomy, stroke unit admission, and 6‑month follow-up). This is NOT an official SSNAP instrument and is for demonstration/testing only.
audit.population: Adults admitted with suspected acute stroke (demo)

questionnaire.title: SSNAP-style Demo Questionnaire v1
questionnaire.description: A structured, analysable, SSNAP-style audit form focused on pathway timestamps and key process measures. Intended for demo import into the Audit Builder.

questions.question_text: How was the case classified at discharge?
questions.help_text: Select the final discharge classification used locally for this admission.
questions.clinical_guidance: Use the discharge diagnosis/category used for reporting.

questions.question_text: Stroke type (if stroke confirmed)
questions.help_text: If Q1 is not ‘Confirmed stroke’, choose the best available classification.
questions.clinical_guidance: Based on final clinical/radiological diagnosis.

questions.question_text: Was the symptom onset time known?
questions.help_text: Known onset means a specific onset datetime can be recorded.
questions.clinical_guidance: If unwitnessed/uncertain onset, record ‘No’ and capture last known well instead.
questions.variable_description: Whether symptom onset datetime is known.

questions.question_text: Symptom onset date & time (if known)
questions.help_text: Use 24-hour time. If unknown, leave blank and complete last known well.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for onset→arrival / onset→treatment metrics.

questions.question_text: Last known well date & time (if onset not known)
questions.help_text: Record the last time the patient was known to be without stroke symptoms.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for pathway timing when onset is unknown.
questions.variable_description: Last known well datetime (when onset is unknown).

questions.question_text: Arrival at first hospital date & time
questions.help_text: The time the patient arrived at the first hospital in the pathway.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for arrival-based metrics (e.g., imaging within 20 minutes; stroke unit admission within 4 hours).

questions.question_text: Mode of arrival
questions.help_text: How the patient arrived at the first hospital.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports pathway analysis and quality improvement.

questions.question_text: Was brain imaging performed?
questions.help_text: Select ‘Yes’ if CT/MRI brain imaging occurred for this presentation.
questions.clinical_guidance: Imaging timeliness is a key hyperacute process measure.

questions.question_text: Time of first brain imaging (CT/MRI)
questions.help_text: Record the datetime the first brain imaging started or was completed (use local convention consistently).
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports ‘imaging within 20 minutes of arrival’ style metrics.

questions.question_text: Was a stroke-skilled clinician assessment completed within 1 hour of arrival?
questions.help_text: If unsure, choose ‘Unknown’ and record the actual assessment time where possible.
questions.clinical_guidance: This is a key hyperacute assessment timeliness measure.
questions.variable_description: Whether stroke-skilled assessment occurred within 1 hour of arrival.

questions.question_text: Time of first stroke-skilled clinician assessment
questions.help_text: If available, enter the documented assessment time.
questions.clinical_guidance: Can be used to calculate arrival→assessment time.
questions.variable_description: Datetime of first stroke-skilled clinician assessment.

questions.question_text: Was intravenous thrombolysis administered?
questions.help_text: For ischaemic stroke pathway only; choose ‘No’ if not given.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for thrombolysis rates and timing metrics.

questions.question_text: Thrombolysis administration date & time
questions.help_text: Record the time thrombolysis was started (bolus time) per local policy.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports door-to-needle / onset-to-needle analyses.

questions.question_text: Door-to-needle time (minutes)
questions.help_text: Minutes from arrival at first hospital to thrombolysis start.
questions.clinical_guidance: Numeric timing helps audit improvement and data validation.

questions.question_text: Was mechanical thrombectomy performed?
questions.help_text: If the patient was transferred for thrombectomy but it was not performed, select ‘No’.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for thrombectomy rates and pathway timing analyses.

questions.question_text: Thrombectomy groin puncture date & time (if performed)
questions.help_text: Record the documented puncture time where available.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports pathway timing analysis for thrombectomy.

questions.question_text: Was the patient taking an anticoagulant on admission?
questions.help_text: Include DOACs/warfarin if taken prior to admission.
questions.clinical_guidance: Relevant for intracerebral haemorrhage reversal pathways.
questions.variable_description: Whether anticoagulant use was present on admission.

questions.question_text: If anticoagulant reversal was indicated, was a reversal agent given within 1 hour of arrival?
questions.help_text: If not applicable (e.g., no indication), select ‘Not applicable’.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports hyperacute intervention metrics for intracerebral haemorrhage pathways.
questions.variable_description: Whether reversal agent was given within 1 hour (if indicated).

questions.question_text: Systolic blood pressure on admission (mmHg)
questions.help_text: Enter the first recorded systolic BP at presentation.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports auditing of BP management pathways (where applicable).
questions.variable_description: First recorded systolic blood pressure on admission.

questions.question_text: If systolic BP > 150mmHg and antihypertensive treatment was indicated, were antihypertensives given within 1 hour of arrival?
questions.help_text: Answer ‘Not applicable’ if criteria not met or treatment not indicated.
questions.clinical_guidance: Used for hyperacute intervention metrics for intracerebral haemorrhage pathways (where relevant).
questions.variable_description: Whether antihypertensives were given within 1 hour when indicated.

questions.question_text: Time of admission to a stroke unit (if admitted)
questions.help_text: Record the datetime the patient was first admitted to a stroke unit bed.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports ‘direct admission to stroke unit within 4 hours’ style metrics.
questions.variable_description: Datetime of admission to stroke unit.

questions.question_text: Was the patient directly admitted to a stroke unit within 4 hours of hospital arrival?
questions.help_text: If the actual time is unknown, choose ‘Unknown’.
questions.clinical_guidance: Stroke unit timeliness is a key pathway measure.
questions.variable_description: Whether stroke unit admission occurred within 4 hours.

questions.question_text: Was a swallow screen completed within 4 hours of arrival (where applicable)?
questions.help_text: Select ‘Not applicable’ if not applicable locally (e.g., already nil by mouth for another reason).
questions.clinical_guidance: Swallow screening is commonly audited as an early inpatient process measure.
questions.variable_description: Whether swallow screen was completed within 4 hours.

questions.question_text: Physiotherapy assessment within 72 hours of admission?
questions.help_text: Choose ‘Unknown’ if documentation is unavailable.
questions.clinical_guidance: Therapy assessment timing supports service planning and improvement.
questions.variable_description: Whether physiotherapy assessment occurred within 72 hours.

questions.question_text: Occupational therapy assessment within 72 hours of admission?
questions.help_text: Choose ‘Unknown’ if documentation is unavailable.
questions.clinical_guidance: Therapy assessment timing supports service planning and improvement.
questions.variable_description: Whether OT assessment occurred within 72 hours.

questions.question_text: Speech and language therapy assessment within 72 hours of admission?
questions.help_text: Choose ‘Unknown’ if documentation is unavailable.
questions.clinical_guidance: Therapy assessment timing supports service planning and improvement.
questions.variable_description: Whether SALT assessment occurred within 72 hours.

questions.question_text: Discharge destination
questions.help_text: Select the destination at discharge from the acute admission.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports outcome/service planning analyses.

questions.question_text: Was a 6-month follow-up completed (where applicable)?
questions.help_text: If your service does not perform 6-month follow-up, select ‘Not applicable’.
questions.clinical_guidance: 6-month follow-up is commonly reported as a quality/process measure.

questions.question_text: 6-month follow-up date
questions.help_text: Record the date the follow-up assessment took place.
questions.clinical_guidance: Supports follow-up coverage/timeliness analysis.

questions.question_text: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) at 6 months (if recorded)
questions.help_text: Select the score recorded at 6 months, if your service captures it.
questions.clinical_guidance: This field is optional in this demo template; use local governance/definitions.

questions.question_text: Comments / data entry notes (optional)
questions.help_text: Optional free-text notes for local use. Avoid patient-identifiable information.
questions.clinical_guidance: Free text is harder to analyse; keep it short and avoid PII.
